channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Business leaders push for privately-run managed isolation
item.description: Privately-run managed isolation could be a reality early next year if business leaders can drum up a suitable plan and convince the government.

item.title: 'Just say you're sorry': Mother of girl who died due to inadequate doctor supervision
item.description: An inexperienced doctor and inadequate supervision meant a critically-ill toddler did not get potentially life-saving treatment.

item.title: Hamilton mall cordoned off as police deal with possible explosive devices
item.description: A Hamilton mall is cordoned off as police and the Defence Force deal with a number of possible homemade explosive devices.

item.title: Woman sneaks onto grounds of managed isolation facility
item.description: Police have charged a 45-year-old woman with unlawfully being on the Rotorua property.

item.title: Listen live: Morning Report for Thursday 6 August
item.description: Today on the show - The fallout from the Beirut explosion continues and Finance Minister Grant Robertson discusses plans for a privately-run mandatory managed isolation.

item.title: Grace Millane murderer's conviction, sentence appeal begins
item.description: The man who murdered Grace Millane is back in court this morning to appeal his conviction and sentence.

item.title: Study to look at psychological, physical impact of caring for mosque attack victims
item.description: A study planning to interview 250 family members of the Christchurch mosque shooting victims, has received a funding grant of close to $100,000.

item.title: 'It's hell': Reality of unemployment despite drop in numbers
item.description: To the surprise of economists, the number of unemployed people fell during the lockdown and with working hours slashed, underutilisation jumped significantly.

item.title: Scientist Siouxsie Wiles: 'If I panic, that's not going to be a good look'
item.description: Eating Fried Chicken in the Shower - Microbiologist and science communicator Siouxsie Wiles talks about science, social media and getting enough sleep.

item.title: Covid-19: Two new cases in managed isolation, legislation to charge some returnees passes all stages
item.description: Two new cases of Covid-19 in managed isolation, legislation to charge some returnees passes all stages and it has been revealed that some guards have fallen asleep on the job at isolation facilities.

item.title: Man who died fleeing police named
item.description: Police have named a man who died after fleeing a pursuit in Flaxmere on Sunday.

item.title: Judges retire to consider appeal against council ban on Southern, Molyneux event
item.description: Three Court of Appeal judges have retired to consider whether Auckland Council broke the law by denying two far right speakers the opportunity to host an event in one of its venues.

item.title: Watch: Primary pupils advocate for fizzy drinks ban
item.description: Checkpoint - Primary school pupils from Porirua today met with politicians in Wellington to lobby for a national sugary drinks ban after their school's 25-year success with the policy.

item.title: More than 800 marriage celebrants' privacy breached - DIA
item.description: A North Island marriage celebrant is questioning how secure government data is, after her address was accidentally published online.

item.title: Police name man who died in Whanganui River
item.description: The man's body was recovered from the river yesterday, just over an hour after reports of a man in distress.

item.title: Eastbourne cycling, walking path gets $15m government funding
item.description: Government funding for a long championed cycleway in Wellington is being enthusiastically received.

item.title: Police arrest man who pointed gun at officer
item.description: Police have arrested a man who pointed a gun at an officer in West Auckland this morning.

item.title: Yachties on visitor visa can apply for extension, immigration says
item.description: A British yacht owner whose visa expires next month is relieved he and others now have a chance to stay in New Zealand longer.
